author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Danville throttles Mansfield
text: by Travis Simpson The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:37 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 37 views | 0 | 0 | | DANVILLE — The Danville Little Johns defeated the Mansfield Tigers 43-13 on Friday at Little John Field.The Little Johns (3-3, 2-1 3A-4 Conference) went up 29-7 at half. Jake Madding drew first blood with a 21-yard run. Madding added the 2-point conversion go up 8-0. Jamey Holbrook scored net on a 1-yard run, and Omar Aquino added the PAT to put Danville up 15-0.Mansfield (1-5, 0-3) scored on a 34-yard run by Christian Saygnaphay. Chris Smith added the PAT to make it 15-7 with time still remaining in the first quarter — enough for the Little Johns to make it 22-7 with a 10-yard run by Juan Gomez.Gomez scored twice in the fourth quarter with Aquino adding the PAT each time. Mansfield set the final score on a 7-yard run on the final play of the game.Danville will travel to Lavaca on Friday.
